title: Jimmy Carter and Rosalynn celebrate 75 years of marriage
description: Images of Jimmy and Rosalynn Carter as the former US presidential couple celebrate their anniversary.

title: Ray BLK: Why debut album Access Denied has taken so long to make
description: The RnB singer felt lost after winning a huge award that she'd hoped would fast-track her to success.

title: The police defecting as a new civil war looms in Myanmar
description: As Myanmar heads towards a new civil war, the BBC hears from police officers who defected after the coup.

title: Euros 2020: What all of us can learn from Gareth Southgate
description: The England boss has turned to experts outside football to help prepare his team. Should we all take note?

title: How Paula Rego remains a master storyteller
description: The artist's new exhibition asserts her status as one of Britain's leading figurative painters.

title: 'Probation officers are the forgotten part of the criminal justice system'
description: Probation officer Sam Gildersleeve shows us a job that often isn't seen in police shows.

title: Why North America's killer heat scares me
description: It's not the new record temperatures that concern the BBC's Roger Harrabin - it's the way they were smashed.

title: Afghanistan withdrawal stokes fears of al-Qaeda comeback
description: An emboldened Taliban has raised the spectre of international terrorism making an unwelcome return.

title: The push to get Australian men and boys to open up
description: Australia is examining beliefs about what makes "real men" in a bid to reduce suicide and violence.

title: Bibaa and Nicole: The life after death of two sisters
description: Bibaa Henry and Nicole Smallman died in a senseless attack. But they should not be remembered as victims.

title: Covid: Self-isolation to be scrapped for double-jabbed and children in England
description: Under-18s in England also won't have to self-isolate if a close contact tests positive from 16 August.

title: Stockwell Six: Three men have 1972 convictions quashed by Court of Appeal
description: The men, jailed for allegedly attempting to rob a policeman nearly 50 years ago, feel 'vindicated'.

title: Vauxhall UK plant safe with electric vehicle plan
description: The Ellesmere Port factory will get a £100m investment to build electric vehicles and protect 1,000 jobs.

title: BBC star salaries: Gary Lineker still BBC's top earner despite pay cut
description: He agreed to a wage cut last year while Zoe Ball, second on the list, asked for a pay reduction.

title: England v Denmark: How Luke Shaw went from Jose Mourinho's fall-guy to Euro 2020 star
description: Humiliated by Jose Mourinho, Luke Shaw has recovered to become England's most creative attacking force at Euro 2020. So how has he done it?

title: Huge surge in number of pupils sent home due to Covid
description: More than 640,000 pupils in England were not in school last week due to Covid - up from 375,000 the week before.

title: Euro 2020: Pubs to stay open later for final on Sunday
description: Premises will be able to stay open until 11.15pm, in case the game goes to extra time and penalties.

title: Raducanu 'will come back stronger' after Wimbledon retirement - Keothavong
description: Emma Raducanu will "come back stronger" after retiring in the Wimbledon fourth round, her Billie Jean King Cup captain Anne Keothavong says.

title: Bank of England asks staff to come in once a week
description: Many firms are still not asking staff to return to the office despite restrictions set to end on 19 July.

title: Covid in India: Tackling lack of online learning in Delhi's slums
description: Devanshi, 21, helps children who are at risk of losing school forever - particularly girls.

title: France in a fizz over Russia's champagne label law
description: A law forcing French fizz makers to label their bottles as sparkling wine has left them bubbling.

title: England cricket team hit by positive Covid tests
description: England name a new squad for their ODI series with Pakistan after three players and four staff members tested positive for Covid-19.

title: Prof Chris Whitty: Second man charged with common assault
description: England's chief medical officer was accosted in a London park last month.

title: US left Bagram Airbase at night with no notice, Afghan commander says
description: American troops quietly withdrew from the key airbase in the early hours, new base commander says.

title: Woman speaks out over Elvis performer rape ordeal
description: Kirsty McKell is waiving her right to anonymity to urge other victims of sexual abuse to speak out.

title: Copa America: Neymar sets up Paqueta for only goal in semi-final
description: Neymar's trickery sets up Lucas Paqueta to score the winner for Brazil in their Copa America semi-final win over Peru.

title: Gareth Southgate: Euro 2020 semi-final a 'very special opportunity' for England
description: England have a "very special opportunity" to make the country happy when they face Denmark in their Euro 2020 semi-final, says Gareth Southgate.

title: Euro 2020: Denmark’s journey through the eyes of the country
description: Denmark are riding the crest of a wave at the European Championship, but how have those from the country seen the tournament and how far the team will go?

title: Rehab in Wales: 'Prison is the safest place for my mum'
description: Ex-offenders, experts and support services all want better rehabilitation services in Wales.

title: Newspaper headlines: Now or never, says PM, after lockdown ending 'gamble'
description: Almost all Tuesday's papers lead with Boris Johnson's plans to end Covid restrictions in England on 19 July.
